lines.text: What's your name?
hipswinging!
[the court erupts in laughter]
Now, Miss LaRue, just what constitutes a striptease?
A good constitution and a couple of zippers.
[the court erupts in laughter again]
Don't be ambiguous.
Oh, I won't if you won't.
[Smiles and sticks out her tougue. More courtroom laughter]

[to the heavy drinking Tod Newton]
You sure drink a good dinner.
What kind of a guy is Patch Gallagher, Rosie?
Compared to him an elephant's hide is tissue paper, but he sure knows his stuff.

Yes, yes, yes, the top spot. Where if you drop, you've got twice as far to fall. Maybe I'm a sap for trying. And maybe I can make something out of you, if you can stand up when I get through with you.
I've got good legs, Mr. Gallagher.
Yes, so I've noticed; but, don't let them run away with you.
[first lines]
I don't like the looks of this place Todd.
Ah, come on. You'll get a lot of laughs.
[last lines]
Say, what is this you're dishing out?
Can't you take it?
[Kiss]
The judge will give you 15 years for what you're thinking.
It'd be worth it.
Sorry to tell ya, but I'm the kind of investment that doesn't pay.
I'm like the guy throwing quarters in the slot machine. I keep on trying.
I'll stick to those thousand-to-one shots - sometimes they win.
You didn't stop to think that I might have to wrestle my way home did you?
That's all right. Let him insult you. Plenty a girl has cashed in on a good hearted insult.

[reading a note from Tod]
Don't say 'them things'. Don't say 'can it'. Don't say 'guy'. Don't buy shoes with ribbons on them. Don't forget, what's a striptease on 2nd Avenue is art on Broadway. The $50 is to buy you a dress without a zipper.
I'm the best musician in the country.
Yeah, but how are ya in the city?
Listen Paderewski, were them funny noises comin' outta you or the piano?

[During a raid at the Burlesque House]
Wait a minute, you... Come on up to the station house, the Lieutenant is throwing a party.
Can't I even get some clothes!
No, he wants you just as you are.
Oh, it's that kind of a party!
You could dream better if you'll get to sleep.
I'm through dreamin'. I'm gonna start doin'. I'm going up where its art. Uptown.

And you all can tell that Mr. Gallagher, that cotton will grow black before I come to see him again, sir! Where we all come from, the gentlemen know how to speak to ladies. And you can tell him from me...
Break it up, you all go back to the Mason-Dixon line, sugar.
So, you took Warner, eh?
Yeah, I know she's not so hot, but with all the real talent going Hollywood, you've got to make the best of what you can get.
We'll be down to using midgets pretty soon.
Well, work on her. Use a whip if you have to, she's got to be loosened up by the time we open.
I'll offer her candy, maybe she like's candy.
Offer her anything, but, more money.
You didn't really mean to walk out on me just for a few costumes.
Rather than send beautiful girls out in those, I'd let them go on naked.
You know, Papa, that's a swell idea.
That's the same idea that got you kicked out of school!
We're always looking for fresh talent. You can sing and dance, I suppose?
Yes sir.
But, Papa, how 'bout her rhythm?
Eh-eh, that's Gallagher's job, not yours.
You sure have got rhythm, baby.
Yeah, well, keep your hands off it.
Do you like gardenias?
I love 'em!
I could take you in my yacht to Tahiti where they grow wild, millions of 'em.
Hoping I'd go wild too, huh?
It might do you a world of good, Janie.
Tod, dance me towards the bedroom, will you?
Hmmm...
I want to get my coat. I'm going home.
You think you're a dancer, huh. You'll never be an artist until you find out what life's about.
You ought to open up a art school for chorus girls.
I milked a cow once.
What kind of a cow was it? A Jersey or a Guernsey?
I don't know. I didn't see the license plate.
Hey, look, those guys are a lot of silk hats and silk socks with nothing between. That's what all these dames fall for. Don't let it fool you. It never works out.
But...
Dancing is your racket, Duchess, I know it.
I'm not going to run out on you.
Maybe I ought to speak Cuban! And it's the same in any language!
Wait a minute, the boss is all steamed up and this ain't no Turkish bath.
